events.name: Electric Party! - An Arduino Workshop
events.description:
In this 3 hour crash course, you will learn the fundamentals of Arduino programming and have fun making your party gadgets with Arduino, LEDs, sensors, actuators and simple everyday materials. We will also turn off the lights and party when we're done.

NO PRIOR EXPEREINCE REQUIRED :D 

Sign up here: RSVP: http://goo.gl/forms/3pKem3TRW7
(10 Pax only, so grab your seat asap!) 
Not to mention, $30 is the discounted price for NUS students, compared to public price S80! Really great deal brought to us by 12 Geeks!

Course Details: 

Section 1 - Setting up Arduino IDE & Introduction to Arduino
Section 2 - Output - Playing with LEDs, Piezo, Potentiometer
Section 3 - Input - Playing with Potentiometer and Sensors
Section 4 - Motion Playing with Servo Motors
Finale - Build your own Party gadget

Please bring your own laptop with the Arduino IDE installed. Available for download here: http://www.arduino.cc/en/main/software

events.name: Bluemix SG Meetup #7: Implement Microservices-based App on Bluemix
events.description: Hi SG Blumix-ologists, Have you ever heard about Microservices and want to know more about what it is? Throughout 2014 and into 2015, Microservice became the hot new buzzword, quickly supplanting cloud. In a nutshell, Microservices is an architectural style in which large, complex software applications are composed of one or more smaller services. Each of these Microservices focuses on completing one task that represents a small business capability.  In the Bluemix meetup #7, we will be covering these topics: * Motivations of Microservices Architecture * Key Elements of Microservices Architecture * Microservices and DevOps * Demo of implementing a Microservices Architectured App on Bluemix
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951

events.name: Become a Technical Speaker
events.description: There are a lot of people in the community who are amazing developers. I realized some of them never share or speak at a public event. This is mostly for them. The devs I love the most and the developers who are highly knowledgable but too shy to share.

events.name: Singapore SQL PASS Chapter - Feb 2016 Meetup
events.description: Dear All, SQL Server User Group meet up for February is scheduled on Feb 25th ( Thursday ) at 7 PM as usual. Speaker and topic details provided below Agenda: Feb 25th - 6:45 PM to 7 PM - Registration and Snacks 7 PM to 8:15 PM - Topic 1 - Presentation by Dharmendra Keshari 8:15 PM to 8:30 - Break 8:30 PM to 9:15 - Topic 2 - Presentation by Khilitchandra Prajapati Location: Microsoft Office, One Marina Boulevard, Conf Room SINOMB 22CF-15 (24) AV Topic 1: Performance monitoring and Tuning Series: - Waits and Queues Abstract : Wait Stats play a crucial role in identifying the correct root cause of a performance problem and also zeroing in on the actual query causing the slowness. This month's session will cover wait states, queuing process and the life cycle of a thread. Session will also explain the common wait types observed and their implications. Session would share a few useful DMVs and scripts for monitoring wait statistics. Speaker Profile: Dharmendra Keshari has strong and in-depth experience in Database Management and its internals. Currently, working as Senior Database Administrator in one of the best Semi-Government organization in Singapore. He is an avid, regular mentor on social media, helping several enthusiast in solving problems related to Database management. He has completed certification for “Microsoft SQL Server® 2008, Implementation” and “Maintenance & Administering Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Database” Topic 2: Deep dive into Configuring SSIS Packages  Abstract: Configuring SSIS Packages can be a tricky problem to encounter more often than not. This session on SSIS Packages will run thro various methods in configuring SSIS packages, their pros and cons and the scenarios at which they can be applied. The Session will also cover the end to end deployment cycle of a SSIS Package and discuss package and project deployment models. The session would explain the various best practices to be followed while configuring and deploying SSIS Packages. Speaker Profile: Khilitchandra V. Prajapati, an Enterprise Architect (Data Warehouse & Business Intelligence) at Marina Bay Sands, Singapore. He has implemented various BI solutions in last couple of years for industries like Oil & Gas, Banking, Telecom, Insurance, Casino & Gaming, Hospitality and IT. His prime focus is on Microsoft BI Stack (SQL Server, SSAS, SSIS, SSRS) with MOSS, C#.Net. He is a MSBI enthusiast and shares his knowledge, experience & expertise via his blog (www.bigator.com) Please send in your RSVP for a informative and fun filled session.
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: Tooling using Bower, NPM, Gulp, Git, etc. for ASP.NET Core 1.0
events.description: Tooling using Bower, NPM, Gulp, Git, etc. for ASP.NET Core 1.0 Full Demo, Less Slides (#FDLS) Session! #Update: ASP.NET 5 is dead. We rename ASP.NET 5 into ASP.NET Core 1.0 to make it clearer. Lots of differences when developing web for ASP.NET 4 and ASP.NET Core 1.0. Especially the tooling. See how to develop ASP.NET Core 1.0 using the open source tooling inside Visual Studio or just using command line console. Speaker 1: Riza MarhabanTopic: ASP.NET Core 1.0 Web Tooling using Bower, NPM,             Gulp, Git, etc. for  Code Demo: * MVC 6 * Bootstrap * AngularJS * Entity Framework 7 Speaker 2: Ujjwal KumarTopic: Creating Identity based solutions with Azure You don't want to miss this one. Please join and bring your friends if want to understand ASP.NET Core 1.0 web development. Venue (auditorium), pizza and drinks sponsored by Microsoft. Remember to bring photo ID to get through NTUC Centre Building security at Level 1. See you at the venue!
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: The first meetup for 2016!
events.description: Agenda Wang Qiang will give an introduction on running Spark on mesos in Docker and share with us why Mesos was chosen. He will demonstrate how to setup Spark on Mesos. If you like to follow along, bring along your laptop.  Speaker Bio Wang Qiang, PhD, Data Integration EngineerGraduated from EEE, NTU in 2014 batch. Interned in Deloitte Data Analytics Institute in 2013. Worked for Revolution Analytics Singapore as Software Engineer in 2013 for CloudR product development. Worked for Razer as Senior Software Engineer from 2014 to 2015 for Big Data Platform built up. Implemented a full stack (data collection, ETL, data analysis and reporting) Big Data tools for Razer internal usage using  recent open source projects such as Docker, Mesos, Kubernetes, Spark, and prediction.io.
events.location: IDA Lab @ National Design Center , #03-04 111 Middle Road, Singapore

events.name: Betwixt Festival ArtScience Late - Interstice: Imageries & Bodies
events.description:
February's free ArtScienceLate is part of Betwixt Festival
http://2016.betwixtfestival.com/ #betwixtfestivalsg

Our Thursday, 25 Feb event features two performances:

VIDEO CONFERENCE: CO-OPTIVE
By Urich Lau Collaborators: Marcel Gaspar & Teow Yue Han 7:30pm
From photos and videos, to texts and bits of information in our multimedia devices, the work aims to reveal the mundane obsessiveness in trying to know all, see all, and do all.

P.P.M. [PUZZLED.PROCESSED.MESHED.]
By Otto Krause and Milan Loviška with Alwyn Burger and Jason Nel
8:15pm
Using trampolines as nonsensical game controllers or full-body game pads, the artists transform the exhaustive activity of jumping into unexpected virtual representations and digital interactions.
